detaileddescription.para: Used in KFTX_SetPersonalizationIfBap

Set personalization settings depends on BAP usage
values 0x0FU
Used in KFTX_SetPersonalizationIfBap

Set personalization settings depends on BAP usage - empty
values 0x00U
Used in KFTX_SetPersonalizationIfBap

Set personalization settings depends on BAP usage - bit0
values 0x01U
Used in KFTX_SetPersonalizationIfBap

Set personalization settings depends on BAP usage - bit1
values 0x02U
Used in KFTX_SetPersonalizationIfBap

Set personalization settings depends on BAP usage - bit2
values 0x04U
Used in KFTX_SetPersonalizationIfBap

Set personalization settings depends on BAP usage - bit3
values 0x08U
RTE Write Typedef

Typedef used for RTE Read function pointers
values N/A
RTE Read Typedef
Typedef used for RTE Read function pointers
Pointer array to functions that return Std_ReturnType

This array points to functions like Rte_Read_KFTX_WakeupSleep_s_[CAN_BUS]_Comm_Active, which provide CAN_BUS activity status
range Std_ReturnType - see Std_Types.h values N/A unit N/A resolution N/A context KFTX_ReadCANStates protection none storage class init ram
Bus states array

This array stores the bus states for each bus
For each position in array: range True if corresponding bus is active False otherwise values N/A unit N/A resolution N/A context KFTX_ReadCANStates, KFTX_UpdatePduCounters, KFTX_GetKommErrorStatus protection none storage class init ram
PDU Timeout counter array

This array stores the timer values for each PDU used for communication error status handling. The values are stored as tens of miliseconds, because the KFTX component is running cyclically at 10ms
For each position in array: range uint16 values N/A unit 10s of ms resolution N/A context KFTX_InitPduTimeoutCounters, KFTX_UpdatePduCounters, KFTX_GetKommErrorStatus protection none storage class init ram
PDU data structures array

This array stores the information about each PDU used for communication error status handling. We map each PDU to their PDU Statuses, buses and timeout values The timeout values are calculated based on the KMatrix PDU's normal cycle time * 10ms.
range N/A values N/A unit N/A resolution N/A context KFTX_InitPduTimeoutCounters, KFTX_UpdatePduCounters, KFTX_GetKommErrorStatus protection none storage class init ram

N/A
N/A
bapAktiv_bo
- used to check if BAP is active or inactive. range boolean resolution N/A unit N/A
void

Input->Output-Correlation

memberdef.argsstring: (boolean bapAktiv_bo, Rte_Write_func aufSelektiv_COV, uint8 lowerNibble_mask_u8, uint8 komfortFensterheber_u8, boolean writeKomfortNurFhFahrertuer_bo)
memberdef.name: KFTX_SignalHandle__AufSelektiv

detaileddescription.para: Helper function for BAP interactions.

Function used to handle signals: KFT_bFHFTAufSelektiv_COV (Komfort Driver Door), KFT_bFHBTAufSelektiv_COV(Komfort Passenger Door), KFT_bFHHFSAufSelektiv_COV (Komfort Rear Driver Door) and KFT_bFHHBFSAufSelektiv_COV (Komfort Rear Passenger Door).
N/A
N/A
bapAktiv_bo
- used to check if BAP is active or inactive. range boolean resolution N/A unit N/A
aufSelektiv_COV
- used to set KFT_bFHFTAufSelektiv_COV (Komfort Driver Door), KFT_bFHBTAufSelektiv_COV (Komfort Passenger Door), KFT_bFHHFSAufSelektiv_COV (Komfort Rear Driver Door) and KFT_bFHHBFSAufSelektiv_COV (Komfort Rear Passenger Door). range Rte_Write_func resolution N/A unit N/A
lowerNibble_mask_u8
- used to check if komfortFensterheber_u8 is either 0x0F or 0x00. range uint8 resolution N/A unit N/A
komfortFensterheber_u8
- if BAP is active and komfortFensterheber_u8 is 0x0F, KFT_bFHFTAufSelektiv_COV (Komfort Driver Door), KFT_bFHBTAufSelektiv_COV(Komfort Passenger Door), KFT_bFHHFSAufSelektiv_COV (Komfort Rear Driver Door) and KFT_bFHHBFSAufSelektiv_COV (Komfort Rear Passenger Door) will be set to TRUE. range uint8 resolution N/A unit N/A
writeKomfortNurFhFahrertuer_bo
- if BAP is inactive set aufSelektiv_bo to KFT_bFHFTAufSelektiv_COV (Komfort Driver Door). range boolean resolution N/A unit N/A
void
Globals N/A
Input->Output-Correlation N/A
reentrant No context KFTX_SetPersonalizationIfBap thread safe No multicore safe No synchronous Call Sequence

Verification criteria

Function the returns the communication error status for a specific PDU

This function cyclically updates the pdu counters accordingly to the communication error status requirements. After each BUS WAKE-UP, the counters are reset. They are decrementing only if the BUS WAKE-UP is not finished (after the timeout has elapsed or when we receive a NoError pdu status).
N/A
N/A
reentrant No context KFTX_SignalHandle__enStSADKommErrSt, KFTX_SignalHandle__KommErrStatusFrontDoors, KFTX_SignalHandle__KommErrStatusRearDoors thread safe No multicore safe No synchronous
eKFTX_PDU
pdu [in] - the PDU data
uint8 - the communication error status for the PDU
Globals
constKFTX_Msg [in] RTE_CAN_MIRROR_OFFSET [in] KFTX_BUS_STATES [in] KFTX_PDU_TIMEOUT_COUNTERS [in]
Input->Output-Correlation
Based on the value received from KFTX_RteLight_pu8GetAddress(), the communication status is set. KFTX_CAN_KommErrorStatusDelayCounter is called with the right bus state and pdu counter provided by KFTX_BUS_STATES and KFTX_PDU_TIMEOUT_COUNTERS
Call Sequence
Test Method
the testing method is described on:
Verification criteria
Test case shall check if the timers are working according to the requirements. TEST_KFTX_Task__KFTX_GetKommErrorStatus
Satisfies requirement
Design Decision - Justification. This is a helper function to provide the status of CAN message for some errSt signals.
Helper function that returns the communication status based on the state of the bus, the pdu status and the timeout timer value

This function sets the communication error status based on the requirements. While bus sleep, the communication status should be set to init value. If bus is active, if PDU status is NoError, the communication status is set to NoError, else if the timeout is not elapsed, we set it to init (bus is not fully awake), otherwise, the communication status is set to error.

uint8 - the communication error status for the PDU

xrefdescription.para: Design Decision - Justification. Helper function used to manage the delay counter and delayed timeout for each CAN.

detaileddescription.para: Function that cyclically updates the pdu counters

This function cyclically updates the pdu counters accordingly to the communication error status requirements. After each BUS WAKE-UP, the counters are reset. They are decrementing only if the BUS WAKE-UP is not finished (after the timeout has elapsed or when we receive a NoError pdu status).
N/A
N/A
reentrant No context KFTX_TaskCyclicEvent thread safe No multicore safe No synchronous
void
void
Globals
KFTX_BUS_STATES [in] KFTX_PDU_TIMEOUT_COUNTERS [in]
Input->Output-Correlation
Value of pdu counters is set after checking the conditions for KFTX_BUS_STATES and KFTX_PDU_TIMEOUT_COUNTERS
Call Sequence
Test Method
the testing method is described on:
Verification criteria
Test case shall check if the timers are working according to the requirements. TEST_KFTX_Task__KFTX_UpdatePduCounters
Traceability
Satisfies following DOORS Requirements: Satisfies requirement
